title: Rain Dance 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Estate Rosé (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This rather thin wine touches on barely ripe strawberry fruit, with a hefty serving of rhubarb. Made from Pinot Noir, it's simple and light, with a quick fade.

title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Saveurs de Lyre  (Coteaux de l'Auxois)
description: This unusual blend, occasionally found in Alsace, gives a wine that is full and perfumed. It offers almond and spice flavors along with a tight texture. The wine, with its warm acidity, is ready to drink.

title: Pelissero 2013 Nubiola  (Barbaresco)
description: Oak, oak-driven spice, underbrush and roasted coffee bean aromas take center stage and carry over to the palate along with a note suggesting raw cranberry. It lacks fruit richness while bracing, astringent tannins leave a raspy, mouth drying finish.

title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Lago Cerqueira White (Vinho Verde)
description: Fresh and crisp, this is an attractive medium-sweet wine. It has ripe apple fruit that is contrasted with lemon and lime acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Syrah (Tejo)
description: The earthiness of Syrah is very apparent in this wine: it gives the red a rustic barnyard character. Get behind this surface and there is more attractive black fruit as well as some spice. Leave the wine until 2018 in the hope the barnyard will disappear.

title: Quinta das Carvalhas NV Reserva Tawny  (Port)
description: A soft and sweet wine that has good acidity as well as gentle red fruits. The wine is lightly textured and very easy on the palate.

title: Prinsi 2013 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of damp cellar floor and coconut lead the nose while the bracing, rather muddled palate shows red cherry, a green note of powdered sage and a confectionary note. Astringent tannins clench the finish.

title: Veramar 2014 Estate Club Merlot (Virginia)
description: The nose of this wine is all about oak, with toast and char leading the way. The palate follows suit yet shows a bit more fruit, with grilled red-berry flavors washing over a lithe, crisp palate.

title: Verget 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This soft wine has gentle ripe white fruits and lemon-juice flavors. It ends fresh and crisp, with a touch of creaminess to add richness. Drink now.

title: Vinaceous 2014 Sirenya Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)
description: This ripe yet varietally true style features scents of baked pear, ripe melon, cinnamon and allspice. This is plump but lacking true depth, finishing short.

title: Stroppiana 2010 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Weedy underbrush and scorched soil aromas lead the way along with a smoked note. The bitter palate offers a green note of powdered sage and hazelnut but it lacks fruit. Clenching tannins grip the finish.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha White (Tejo)
description: This ripe perfumed wine is soft with attractive melon and kiwi fruit flavors. It is gently textured, spicy and with just enough acidity. There is a touch of pepper at the end.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha

title: Horton 2013 Tannat (Virginia)
description: Blackberries with a hefty dusting of espresso beans mark the nose and palate. Medium bodied, with a mild tannic grip, the acidity races down the midpalate, finishing a bit too tart.

title: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This bottling's extreme grapefruit pithiness meets with rainy cement and a touch of rubber on the nose. The flavors are quite reductive, with tar and sour crab apple touches.

title: Ingleside 2014 Albariño (Virginia)
description: Bruised peach mixed with tropical tones makes for a pleasant, straightforward nose. The palate is juicy and light, focused on pineapple and lightly floral undertones.

title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2014 Toutalga Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a young, fruity wine with fine acidity and plenty of red-fruit flavors. Light spice, generous tannins and a hint of wood all contribute to a balanced wine that is ready to drink.

title: Domaine de la Denante 2014  Saint-Véran
description: Ripe and smooth, this rich wine has enough fruitiness and acidity to give a crisper edge, although it is more about a warm, spicy character. Drink now.

title: Vins Auvigue 2014  Mâcon-Fuissé
description: This wine is round and ripe. It offers spice and acidity along with warm apple flavors, with a light touch of minerality at the end. Drink now.

title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Branco White (Lisboa)
description: A blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, this is light and crisply refreshing. There are some yellow fruit flavors that contrast with the lime acidity. It is ready to drink now.

title: Alfredo Roca 2015 Fincas Pinot Noir (Mendoza)
description: Fresh, fruity cherry, citrus and rose aromas are light and airy. This feels a bit raw and scratchy, while currant, red plum and brown sugar flavors finish juicy, snappy and uncushioned. This has all the requirements of a good picnic Pinot Noir.

title: Anko 2015 Torrontés (Salta)
description: Powdery, soapy aromas are exotic but not fully convincing. Fresh but nothing more than wet and basic on the palate, this shows briny flavors of orange rind through the finish.

title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia White (Vinho Verde)
description: This is classic, off-dry Vinho Verde. With its light prickle, crisp fruit that has a tangy lime and lemon character that comes through the candy flavor, it is a refreshing, light wine.

title: Pascal Rollet 2014 Domaine de la Chapelle Les Perriers  (Saint-Véran)
description: This open, fruity wine has a soft side. Apples and pears are prominent along with a touch of spice. Drink now.
designation: Domaine de la Chapelle Les Perriers

title: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Acte 12 of 1619 Chardonnay (Virginia)
description: Ruddy peach and melon aromas take on a slight dusting of mineral on the nose. The palate is rich, heavy and round in feel, with buttery lemon and melon flavors. Lactic notes carry to the slightly hot finish.

title: Proemio 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Saucy aromas of stewed plum and tomato ragu lack clarity. This is midlevel Cabernet, with a light bounce to its step. Generic cherry, cassis and licorice flavors finish with acidic kick but no sense of refinement.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Vinho Selection Rosé (Tejo)
description: This blend of Touriga Nacional with Merlot is perfumed and light. It has a salmon pink color, layers of citrus as well as red-currant fruit and a soft texture. Drink now.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Le Clos Devouluet Durand-les-Verchès  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Smooth and generous, this wine is soft and missing any bite. It is round and unfocused, but ready to drink now.

title: Enotria 2015 Moscato (Mendocino County)
description: Extremely sweet and extremely sugary, this wine smells like honeydew melon, and tastes as rich as the simple syrup used in cocktails.

title: Horton 2013 South Ridge Touriga Nacional (Virginia)
description: Spiced raspberry with overtones of bramble patch and barnyard aromas. The light-bodied palate is a bit darker in nature, with dark cherry and vanilla rooibos flavors.

title: Finca Flichman 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Gritty berry and plum aromas are blocky. This feels choppy, almost rocky, while baked berry flavors ramble towards a spicy, sappy finish with stewed fruit notes and some residual heat.
